section.title: Formatting expectations
section.p: Processors generally present the content of a pre element in a monospaced font.

section.title: Processing expectations
section.p: Processors SHOULD preserve line breaks and spaces at publication time.

draft-comment.author: Kristen J Eberlein
draft-comment.p: Added normative statement, was not present in DITA 1.3

example.title: Example
example.p: When the following code sample is published, the line breaks and white space are preserved.
example.codeblock:
MEMO: programming team fun day
Remember to bring a kite, softball glove, or other favorite
outdoor accessory to tomorrow's fun day outing at Zilker Park.
Volunteers needed for the dunking booth.
example.p: The rendered result will differ depending on the processor. It will generally look something like this: MEMO: programming team fun day Remember to bring a kite, softball glove, or other favorite outdoor accessory to tomorrow's fun day outing at Zilker Park. Volunteers needed for the dunking booth.
